entry.title: Today in DeFi - unshETH Private Key Leak, EU MiCA Singed, Perps Trading on Polygon zkEVM, and more...
entry.summary: unshETH Private Key Leak One of unshETH deployer’s private keys was compromised and some USH farm rewards and protocol liquidity were compromised. The team paused withdrawals on unshETH Ether and is negotiating with the hackers for a return of lost funds worth 375k. User-deposited funds are safe and unaffected.

entry.title: Today in DeFi - QuickPerps Live on Polygon zkEVM, Lyra Upgrade on Optimism, Vote on Protocol Fees, and more...
entry.summary: QuickPerps Live on Polygon zkEVM QuickSwap launches QuickPerps, a perpetual dex that allows trading of $MATIC, $ETH, $BTC, $USDC, $USDT, and $DAI with up to 50x leverage. Lyra Upgrade on Optimsim Lyra launched an improved version of the protocol on Optimism. The new version uses SNX V2 perpetual futures as a liquidity source to delta hedge the option Market Maker Vaults (MMVs). This improves the capital efficiency of the protocol, increases the percentage of fees returned back to LPs, and allows for more assets to be supported for traders.

entry.title: Today in DeFi - Maker Spark Lend, Prime Protocol Mainnet, Trade to Earn, and more...
entry.summary: Maker Spark Lend Maker launched Spark Lend, its new lending product that allows users to lend/borrow ETH, stETH, DAI, and sDAI. Spark Lend is not available for users from the U.S. Prime Protocol Mainnet Prime Protocol is now live on Ethereum, Avalanche, Arbitrum One, and Moonbeam. Prime allows users to borrow cross-chain backed by their entire portfolio of cross-chain assets. Prime also launches an Early Adopter Program that rewards users with points.

entry.title: Binance topped PEPE, AI charged TURBO, BRC-20 clogged Bitcoin, creating a memecoin in 27 seconds
entry.summary:
The speculative frenzy driven by memecoins appears to have plateaued, with PEPE down over 50% from its all-time high.
PEPE briefly boasted a billion-dollar capitalization after being listed on Binance.
As top-signals go, that was one for the books, with PEPE tumbling 51% from its all-time high after listing on the world’s largest crypto exchange.
Despite its recent losses, PEPE still enjoys a larger market cap than DeFi bluechips like Synthetix, Curve, and Rocket Pool. Traders also exchanged nearly $700M worth of PEPE over just the past 24 hours.
